titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the Neil Juhl Larsen Research Material on Charles Biederman, circa 1927-2011, in the Archives of American Art AAA.larsneil
Larsen (Neil Juhl) research material on Charles Biederman
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Erin Kinhart

note.p: This finding aid is associated with a MARC collection-level record.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-02-12T12:28-0500

did.unittitle: Neil Juhl Larsen research material on Charles Biederman
did.abstract: The Neil Juhl Larsen research material on Charles Biederman measures 9.4 linear feet and dates from circa 1927-2011. The material was compiled primarily by Neil Juhl Larsen in preparation for his biography, Charles Biederman (Hudson Hills Press, 2011). Also included is a small amount of material compiled by art historian Susan Larsen (no relation to Neil), who completed the book after Neil Larsen's death in 2006. The bulk of the research material consists of original papers belonging to Charles Biederman, including biographical material, correspondence, writings, personal business records, printed material, and photographs. These papers were given to Neil Juhl Larsen by Biederman and his daughter Anna Biederman Brown.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged as 2 series.

list.item: Series 1: Charles Biederman Papers, circa 1927-2004 (Boxes 1-6; 6.0 linear feet)
Series 2: Research Files, circa 1941-2011 (Boxes 7-10; 3.4 linear feet)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Washington, D.C. Research Center.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: The Neil Juhl Larsen research material on Charles Biederman is owned by the Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution. Literary rights as possessed by the donor have been dedicated to public use for research, study, and scholarship. The collection is subject to all copyright laws.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Originals of document photocopies and photographs of artwork found in this collection are located at the Weisman Art Museum, University of Minnesota.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated in 2012 by Susan M. Fridley, Neil Juhl Larsen's widow. Original material came directly from Charles Biederman and his daughter Anna Biederman Brown for the purposes of completing Biederman's biography and was compiled by Neil Larsen, and after his death, by Susan Larsen.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Neil Juhl Larsen research material on Charles Biederman, circa 1927-2011. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: The collection was processed to a minimal level and a finding aid prepared by Erin Kinhart in 2014. The collection was minimally rearranged and retaind the existing/original folder titles when possible. All materials have been rehoused in archival folders and boxes for long-term stability, but not all staples and other fasteners were removed. Items within folders have not been rearranged.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Also in the Archives of American Art are 23 reels of microfilm (reels 1446-1450 and 1662-1679) of the Charles Biederman papers, loaned for microfilming in 1978-1979. The Biederman papers are now located at the Weisman Art Museum, University of Minnesota. Additionally, the Archives of American Art holds the microfilm of the David Barr papers relating to Charles Biederman (reel 1294), and an oral history interview with Charles Biederman, conducted 1976 May 6, by Paul Cummings.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Neil Juhl Larsen (1956-2006) was a writer, artist, friend, and biographer of modernist painter and sculptor Charles Biederman (1906-2004). Larsen died in 2006 while preparing the biography, and the project was turned over to art historian Susan Larsen (no relation to Neil), who had written on Biederman as well. The biography, Charles Biederman, was published in 2011.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Neil Juhl Larsen research material on Charles Biederman measures 9.4 linear feet and dates from circa 1927-2011. The material was compiled primarily by Neil Juhl Larsen in preparation for his biography, Charles Biederman (Hudson Hills Press, 2011). Also included is a small amount of material compiled by art historian Susan Larsen (no relation to Neil), who completed the book after Neil Larsen's death in 2006. The bulk of the research material consists of original papers belonging to Charles Biederman, including biographical material, correspondence, writings, personal business records, printed material, and photographs. These papers were given to Neil Juhl Larsen by Biederman and his daughter Anna Biederman Brown.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The series is arranged as 6 subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Charles Biederman papers consists of biographical material, correspondence, writings, personal papers, printed material, and photographs which were given to Neil Juhl Larsen during the course of his work on the book Charles Biederman. While most papers are original, some of the writings and correspondence are photocopies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here is scattered biographical material regarding Charles Biederman including various resumes, chronologies and biographical content for Biederman's website. Also found are thoughts on Biederman written by his wife Mary, caregiver notes and recollections, a list of books in Biederman's library, and an oral history interview transcript. Researchers should note that additional documents such as one address book, estate and selective service records, and passports are primarily photocopies of originals.

did.unittitle: Archives of American Art Oral History Transcript
Caregiver's Journal and Various Personal Recollections
Thoughts on Charles Written by Mary Biederman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The majority of correspondence is between Charles Biederman, his wife Mary, and daughter Anna. Included are "Morning Notes" which Biederman would write late at night in his studio and leave on the breakfast table for Mary and Anna to read in the morning. Many of these are illustrated. Also included is correspondence with Mary's brother-in-law and sister, John and Eugenie Anderson. John Anderson was also an patron of Biederman's early artistic work. Additional correspondence of note is with writers Leif Sjoberg, Joan Waddell Barnes, and artist Jean Albert Gorin. The bulk of the correspondence found here is either photocopies or typescripts of originals.

did.unittitle: Barnes, Joan Waddell - Excerpts from Letters
"Morning Notes" to Mary and Anna Biederman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Writings include notebooks, notes, poetry, essays, and other draft writings by Charles Biederman. Most of the writings are on nature. Researchers should note that most of these documents are photocopies of originals, especially writings dating before 1995.

did.unittitle: "The Creative Structural Process of Nature Part II"
Writings by David Bohm, Annotated by Charles Biederman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here is a small amount of Charles Biederman's personal business records, including his dealings with the Archives of American Art and Weisman Art Museum, reproduction agreements, and deeds of gift for his artwork to various individuals.

did.unittitle: Permissions to Reproduce for Search For New Arts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed material primarily consists of exhibition catalogs and announcements for Biederman's work, as well as a few press releases, conference publications, and magazines. Also included is one book containing annotations by Biederman.

did.unittitle: Annotated Book, Science and Sanity by Alfred Korzybski

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Numerous photographs depict Charles Biederman, his wife Mary and daugther Anna, thier home and studio, and exhibitions of his work. Also included are photographs of friends and family and Biederman's 1988 trip to Europe, as well as photographs, slides, transparencies, and negatives of Biederman's artwork.

did.unittitle: Exhibition Opening at Cedar Rapids Museum of Art
Photographs and Transparencies for "Search for New Arts"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here are Neil Juhl Larsen's research files regarding Charles Biederman compiled during his work on the book Charles Biederman, which was published in 2011 after Larsen's death. A small amount of material compiled or annotated by Susan Larsen for the completion of the book is also included. Files contain notes, annotated photocopies of original documents, articles on Biederman, photographs, and a small amount of correspondence. Research files document many aspects of Biederman's life and career, including extensive documentation on his artwork and writings, as well as related subject matter. Of note is a research binder belonging to Neil Juhl Larsen which includes original correspondence with Biederman, photographs, and other material documenting their collaboration on this book project. Researchers should note that much of the research material is photocopies which are often annotated by Larsen. Also included is a set of color snapshots of preliminary sketches, artworks on paper, designs, and drawings by Charles Biederman.

did.unittitle: Jan Van der Marck Files on Charles Biederman
List of Published Articles by Charles Biederman
Mary Biederman's Journals, Excerpts and Photocopies
Notes from Conversations with Charles Biederman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Color snapshots of preliminary sketches, artworks on paper, designs, and drawings by Charles Biederman. Photographs also includes annotations by Biederman.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Color snapshots of preliminary sketches, artworks on paper, designs, and drawings by Charles Biederman. Photographs also includes annotations by Biederman.

did.unittitle: Printed Material on Related Subject Matter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs, correspondence between Larsen and Biederman, and original writings by Biederman.

did.unittitle: "Art As the Evolution of Visual Knowledge"
Thesis, "The Art of Charles Biederman," David Lee Craven
Thesis, "The Search for a Constructive Art," David John Barr (1965)
Weisman Art Museum, Inventory of Archival Material
